ai-mil5.3.1:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, the Buddha has said these words:

ai-mil5.3.1:2.1_0: “Great king, the Buddha has performed this matter.
ai-mil5.3.1:3.1_0: There are these two things for ascetics who are worthy of offerings, ancestors, and canopies, offer them a distance.
ai-mil5.3.1:3.2_0: What are the two qualities for an ascetic, and the two things for ascetics?
ai-mil5.3.1:3.3_0: Restlessness is the best: restraint, restraint in conformity with the restraint of the Dhamma, clarity, restraint, patience, and wearing shamelessness, fostering goodness, energy, rapture and blissfulness, immersion, and equanimity. He fulfills the training rules for retreat.
ai-mil5.3.1:3.4_0: These are the two things for ascetics who make an ascetic, and two things assemblies of ascetics.
ai-mil5.3.1:3.5_0: They undertake and follow these things, they’re a mendicant who hasn’t fulfilled the precepts, and because they haven’t fulfilled their special qualities. They’t acquire more perfected ones. They haven’t attained Arahantship. They’t because they’ve entered upon the greater, the majesty, the perfected one, and the one who stands on the path to perfection.

They are capable of having given up all these things. They don’t train in the teaching and training. They are stream-enterers, not a mendicant.
ai-mil5.3.1:12.1_0: The prince, separately, in front of me, and he trains in his presence. He trains himself in the presence of the teacher. He trains himself, the teacher’s a teacher.
ai-mil5.3.1:12.2_0: In the same way, great king, a mendicant who is training can bow to a monk, offer him a stream-enterer, not a perfected one.
ai-mil5.3.1:13.1_0: Still, great king, this is a way to understand how they have attained idiosyncratic in this way.

ai-mil5.3.1:13.3_0: For that is no confirmed going forth, great king, that is, a mendicant who has gone forth.”
